{{cpp/title|va_list}}
{{cpp/utility/variadic/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=cstdarg|typedef /* unspecified */ va_list;}}

{{tt|va_list}} is a complete object type (in practice, a unique built-in type or {{c/core|char*}}) suitable for holding the information needed by the macros {{lc|va_start}}, {{lc|va_copy}}, {{lc|va_arg}}, and {{lc|va_end}}.

If a {{tt|va_list}} instance is created, passed to another function, and used via {{lc|va_arg}} in that function, then any subsequent use in the calling function should be preceded by a call to {{lc|va_end}}.

It is legal to pass a pointer to a {{tt|va_list}} object to another function and then use that object after the function returns.
